Uses of Package
ej.microui.io

Packages that use ej.microui.io
ej.microui.io   
ej.mwt   
ej.mwt.rendering   
 

Classes in ej.microui.io used by ej.microui.io
Buttons
          A Buttons event generator is usually associated to a group of physical buttons and allow to generate events relating to them.

For a specified subset of buttons it holds the elapsed time since the last event occurrence for that button and supports the optional generation of click and double click events.
Display
          A Display object represents a pixelated screen in the platform, and there is a display for each such pixelated screen.
Displayable
          Displayable is an abstract class which defines the very objects that can be shown on a Display.
A Displayable object is built for a specific Display which can not be changed afterwards.
DisplayFont
          A DisplayFont defines how text is rendered on a Display.
DisplayFonts are never created by applications, but are rather retrieved from the implementation environment.

An application can get all available fonts with DisplayFont.getAllFonts(), or query for a particular font: in this case the implementation will return the most appropriate font matching the request.

The height gives the height of a line of text with the font.
ExplicitFlush
          An ExplicitFlush is a GraphicsContext where flushing data to the screen must be done explicitly by the application.
FlyingImage
          The FlyingImage class defines an image to be displayed at the top level in the rendering depth of a display.

A FlyingImage contains an Image.
Font
          A Font defines how text is rendered on a screen.

A Font is defined by one or more identifiers, a style and a descriptor.
GraphicsContext
          The GraphicsContext class offers basic drawing facilities, to render lines, rectangles, polygons, arcs and text.

GraphicsContext uses 24-bit RGB color.
Image
          An Image object holds graphical display data.
Pointer
          A Pointer event generator represents a pointing device that is usually associated to a group of physical buttons.
Screen
          A Screen represents an hardware screen with its characteristics: width, height, number of supported colors, backlight etc.
